channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 24th February
item.description:
ENWD Fallen branch verge/FW Please remove debris from FW and verge and remove fallen branch Chain saw required 6m approx Standard TM (Damaged Tree)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 'Emergency fix' not a fix, 24th February
item.description:
The emergency fix done to the road at the junction of Stanway Road is not a fix. It has come out leaving the road in a worse position than before. The whole of Whittington Road is undriveable at present and needs to be sorted. Occupants' cars are getting damaged and it is clear to see why - the council are at fault for this as these potholes have been reported multiple times.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Whittington Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple large potholes outside 22 Whittington Road, 24th February
item.description:
There are large multiple potholes outside 22 Whittington Road. As the occupier I am unable to park on my drive without hitting them as our my neighbours. Our cars are getting damaged as a result. These potholes have been here for months and are getting worse every time it rains. Urgent action is needed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Whittington Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -CW6 Potholes problem, 24th February
item.description:
2Hr Pothole CW 700x400x90mm Road closure STATS TEMP REPAIR (CW6 Pothole)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: The utility box and the lamppost here are covered in graffiti., 24th February
item.description:
I reported this graffiti months ago via FixMyStreet but nothing has been done about it. It's very much to the detriment of my local area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 236, Prestbury Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham

The constant stream of rubbish continues. The mattress arrived over the weekend.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Pates Avenue, Alstone, Cheltenham

item.title: Car parking on road dangerous, 24th February
item.description:
Increase in number of cars parked on road and traffic’s using road for the shop at the end of the road. The car parking reduces the visibility and space for turning at the bend. This lead to a traffic accident in the summer. A car was coming down the road to use the turning space adjacent to the bend whilst another car came around the bend and due to parked vehicles couldn’t see the oncoming vehicle that was in the middle of the road .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stancombe View, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, 24th February
item.description:
Potholes from cirencester junction to Tewkesbury in various lanes, particularly the outside lane, been like it for months and the potholes are getting worse, a few times I've seen people swerve to try and miss them
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road Disintegration, 23rd February
item.description:
The section of Kyderminster Road by the junction with Norton and Huddleston is now almost impassible due to the volume and depth of potholes. There are very few drivable areas. I know this has been repeated already but nothing has been done and it is dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kyderminster Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The whole road outside the ladies college customer parking entrance needs repairing ASAP. One particular pothole is waiting to take a cyclist or motorcyclist off their bike. I see multiple cars daily scraping bumpers etc due to the pot hole and general road condition. I am concerned somebody will be injured soon., 23rd February
item.description:
Cheltenham Ladies College, outside the entrance to the customer parking.
